title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive interview for the school psychology. Great professor and training. They not only care about your resume but also your personality and your integrity. Loved the interview process! They hightly value candidates with diverse cultural and language background
Interview Questions: How is your upbringing influence your world view

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple but you have to be prepared to answer any questions, the staff/interviewers were very professional and welcoming and went over the job details at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience

title: Piano Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: 20 min. zoom interview with a panel of maybe 5 or so professors from the music department. No follow-up questions - maybe they are not allowed to ask follow-up, so best to just keep sharing whatever you would like to share
Interview Questions: how I teach, diversity, etc.

title: Locksmith Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview with basic knowledge questions and minor hands on demonstration. Nothing in depth was asked. Panel interview with managers, supervisors, and leads from various departments. Having to do this because Glassdoor is holding me hostage.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience with the trade?

title: WIC Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very professional, and the interview panel was welcoming and professional. The interview was conducted via zoom, and the whole process was organized. The interview lasted for about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: You are brought into a building with a bunch of other students going for that same role. You sit down with a couple faculty and they ask you questions. There is a big emphasis on diversity.
Interview Questions: How is diversity import to you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and I really enjoyed it and learned a lot. I was glad they offered me an opportunity but the staff is sometimes difficult to work with
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Organizational Effectiveness Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: 5 minute phone screen, 15 minute Zoom meeting, 45 minute in person, 1 hour 1x1 in person interview. Seemed highly choreographed but I left feeling confused about the role and the purpose.
Interview Questions: Have you ever missed a deadline, if so, why?

title: Certified Athletic Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Generally typical questions both on phone and in person interview. Questions about how you would handle communicating both with coaches and peers. Coaches themselves were involved in the interview once in person.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a coach that argues with you or ignores your advice?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Minimal questions, short and to the point. Described the work and what type of tasks will be assigned. Describe what you will do dealing with a difficult customer and other scenario questions.
Interview Questions: Work with customer service. How to deal with difficult customers, knowledge of computers.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly easy interview process, as my background matched well with the class agenda.  I also I had a familiarity with the professor who hired me beforehand. I think the most difficult part was going to the office on campus and registering a school employee.
Interview Questions: Q: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick and professional.  I applied and heard back from them in a timely manner.  They asked a couple questions about previous experience and the classes I've taken.  I started the job the following week.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student began to get frustrated that they couldn't understand what they were learning ?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: The staff were friendly enough. But it’s a Slow process, lack of communication, no response after interview and they tend to hire within the university system anyway. That’s across the board for San Diego state university student affairs
Interview Questions: What does feminism mean to you

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The committee never followed up with me if I would be advancing in the interview process.  I reached out to the Director of the program and never received a response.
Interview Questions: My experience working with a specific population of students

title: Manual QA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: I had a one hour long in-person interview which was mostly behavioral with some technical questions. There were eight questions asked in-total.  The interviewer also asked about previous experiences. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Very kind interview staff and response rate was quick. Interview was straightforward and given clear next steps following the interview! Enjoyed the experience and overall turnaround time was about one month.
Interview Questions: What would you consider one of your strengths?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and easy if you are already acquainted with the PI, was part of a normal conversation about further interest within the lab, biggest part was how compatible you are with other current lab members
Interview Questions: How can this lab help you to further your goals within your educational and professional field?

title: Maintenance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very laid back but formal interview. The interviewers were very nice. You should have knowledge of hand tools (ex: pliers, screwdriver, and wire strippers) and building sustainability.
Interview Questions:
Can you name every tool in this bag?
What happens if a room floods?

title: Social Media - Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interview was conducted over zoom by three interviewers who were kind and asked thoughtful questions about my experience with feminism, books or authors that have inspired me. It was laid-back but serious about my commitment to student led organizations.
Interview Questions: What does feminism mean to you?

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Informal and occurred over Zoom. They scheduled the video interview a week or so beforehand, just had to log on at the right time and answer a few questions. It was a one-on-one interview and the interview was personable.
Interview Questions: If you saw a student was struggling, what would you do?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simple, and straightforward, since it is entry-level its more about customer experience and teamwork experience not very intimidating just answer thoroughly and make sure you value inclusivity and diversity and be knowledgeable in what the department does
Interview Questions: What are the best qualities that you bring to a team?

title: Price Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very difficult. Only 15 are chosen every 2 years and multistep interview process. First is the 4 essays that need to be completed and then came the interview with 7 of the staff members.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a price scholar?

title: Clinical Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: The process involved an initial screening, a small panel interview,  delivering clinically relevant presentations, meet and greet opportunities with employees within the counseling center and outside of the counseling center.
Interview Questions: What are examples of issues faced by college students that are important to consider?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Asked pretty straightforward questions, nothing too surprising overall. Who are you, why do you want this position, how does this connect to what you want to do in the future, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you dealt with a difficult situation.

title: RWS Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: There was a simple in-person interview that went over the job requirements, my interest in the position, my potential teaching goals/ambitions, and my previous writing experience, both academically and generally.
Interview Questions:
How have you honed your writing skills while in college?
Do you plan to teach, and if not, why are you interested in this position?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Mentor students, incoming, students who need guidance. The interview process was easy fast and very straightforward. You don’t need anything fancy to do this job just a passion to help others.
Interview Questions: How can you help other students?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was  1 hour and there were 2 interviewers. They asked me some behavioral questions for 15 minutes  and  gave me 2 practical quiz questions within 45 minutes time frame to finish
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 year?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: it was pretty average. they asked a few questions and got to know you. would participate again if they have another opportunity. just be yourself and honest and truthful. they did it through zoom so it might be different in person
Interview Questions: what is your strength and weaknesses

title: Undergraduate Researcher, Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Email then schedule an interview. Very easy to follow up, and you kinda find out on the spot if you get it or not. Then you can schedule the day you wanna start your training and so much more.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work in this lab

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two people were there to ask questions and witness my answers. Some of the questions were interpersonal like what is my favorite hobby? Etc. Others were clearly more serious and required in depth responses.
Interview Questions: Weaknesses Strengths About myself Reason for choosing the the position What do I see myself doing in 5 years

title: Student Asisstant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Emailed them my resume and was called for an interview. The interview lasted only about 20 minutes. I applied to be a student assistant for the department and met the department chair during the interview because it was an informal interview and we were doing it in an office space accessed easily by different people.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths/weaknesses?
How do you feel about this type of work environment?
Standard questions

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really simple since it was online at zoom, the manager was also really nice to students like myself, she asked a couple of questions on what you do, and what year you're in all the basic stuff, and also she tell you about the job description and if you're committed to it. She will also ask a random question based on a specific scenario and you got to show that you have basically some good common sense on how you would deal with the situation at hand, but overall the interview was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: This was a scenario question she asked me, it could be different for everyone else. but she asked, "How would you convince me to go to get lunch with you?"

title: Identity Center Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: They are so slow. Took weeks between three interviews rounds. Then months to get back to you. The interviewers were a mix of students, staff, and faculty. It was awkward to be so enthusiastic when none of them seemed like they wanted to be there. All of the questions were basic.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a conflict and how you handled it

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview first that lasted about 10 minutes and consisted of general questions about myself and my resume. Then I was asked to come in for an in person interview. This lasted about 20 minutes and the questions were mainly behavioral type questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when... (had a difficult customer, handled a stressful situation, etc.)

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy basic and simple. I don't even have 30 words to describe interviews at sdsu. They are flexible and nice and understanding. Be yourself, don't stress too much.  If its on zoom that's even better cause you get to be comfortable
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was semi formal. The professor was a professor I had in a class before so we already knew each other. She asked me basic questions for the spot just for formality.
Interview Questions: Do you have any knowledge of this class?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Find an advisor and a funded project. It helps if you had taken a course under him/her and performed well. Having a good GPA also helps.  And I need 10 more words to complete this form.
Interview Questions: Interest in the field of study

title: IT Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took place in the student affairs office and was very straightforward. Took about 20 minutes and was what you would expect from a on-campus job in a college university.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with software technical issues?

title: Police Cadet Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process is long and taxing but is part of the vetting process. You will go through at least 5 months of interviews, tests, and investigations to see if you are fit for them. This place truly wants the best to work for them. But if you can get through it, it is truly rewarding.
Interview Questions: Too many to list. Mainly pertaining to the department goals and your outlook, as well as personal history questions.

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
You have a first assessment test that is done online. and then a written resume and cover letter. 

The second interview will be with a current Resident advisor manager who will select you if they like you. You are rated on a scale and the managers select you afterward like a draft.
Interview Questions: How did you overcome adversity?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (El Cajon, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was good and transparent . asked simple questions. there were some difficult questions as well. tell me about yourself? why we should hire you? what are you weaknesses? what is the difficult time that you spent? how do you define your previous supervisor/employer?
Interview Questions: why we should hire you?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very short 10 min drive interview talking about where your asked questions about leadership and how you would handle situations and a few technical questions that were meant to simply gauge where one was at with technology
Interview Questions: When was a time you had to demonstrate leadership qualities

title: SDSU ITS Video Production Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual. I met the team, and talked about times available.  They asked to see previous work, and talked about previous experiences.  They also talked about different movies that I enjoy.
Interview Questions: What previous experiences have you had with film production.

title: Graduate Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Mandatory for PhD students, no interview process. There was no interview process, this is a teaching position for graduate students. Generally, I found the teaching options to be diverse and fulfilling, as I taught classes related to my research (Genetics & Evolution) as well as to my interests (Herpetology, Organismal Biology).
Interview Questions: There was no interview process, this is a teaching position for graduate students. Generally, I found the teaching options to be diverse and fulfilling, as I taught classes related to my research (Genetics & Evolution) as well as to my interests (Herpetology, Organismal Biology).

title: Web/Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: They were very thorough on expectations, boundaries and goals before going into detail about how special of a job it is (and it was). They asked me what made me passionate about the position and I had a lot of knowledge about it which led me to get the position.
Interview Questions: What made you go into your field?

title: Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked me the experiences of handling a lab. Softwares that were required so that I could teach them to the class of about 147 students. Later they told me to wait for 2 days for the reply
Interview Questions: How well are you with communication

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: There is an application that requires you to submit two letters of recommendation before you will  have the chance at an interview.  As far as I know the interview process is being overhauled.  They will ask you about your experience with the topics that you may teach and what (if any) experience you have teaching.
Interview Questions: What  makes you qualified to teach [insert course name] ?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: During the interview, we just went through my resume with the professor who are looking for a Graduate Assistant. It's a very laid-back interview process and it's mostly conversational. The professor briefly explained the job responsibilities of the position.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with the Intermediate Accounting materials?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple 30min interview. The interviewer was super nice. He gave me a question to solve on the spot and ask me to explain in detail. This is because the students that come into for tutor have difficulty understanding the materials. As a result, you might have to explain in the common knowledge that they can understand too.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was relaxed with a panel of 2 people. Thought it went well but didn't get the job. Quite competitive because there are many students looking for on-campus jobs and not enough vacancies
Interview Questions: What do you know about San Diego State University's facilities?

title: Aztec Aquaplex Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: This was a formal conducted Skype interview with the Assistant Director of Aquatics and other professional staff. Plan, prepare, and practice all scenarios that you may encounter in the operations of any Aquatics environment. Experience, enthusiasm, and goals focus to recruitment are highly focused upon in their program. I really enjoyed the staffs morals, and near future planning for their programs. This is a well organized operation and it was an honor to have this experience with the interviewers. Levels of professionalism is a consideration as well. I enjoyed speaking to them in this is interview.
Interview Questions: How do you use safety and risk management in your job?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Really laid back. Have fun, they don't want to work with serious people. Act professional but have an outgoing personality, and you'll get the job. Dress business casual. Have a good resume.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite food. What do you like to do in your free time?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: In person interview. Asked about previous experience. Then talked about the project that I would be working on. And discuss about idea on projects. Some basics required to work on project.
Interview Questions: About past experience.

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just applied through faculty office and then they reviewed the resume. The professor interviewed me for less than 15 minutes. He asked about the courses i have taken etc. Nothing really special about it.
Interview Questions: What courses did you take?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very standard. They asked me to submit a resume and cover letter online, then brought me in for an in person interview. I heard back the following week.
Interview Questions:
How would I handle a bad customer interaction?
What are the most important aspects of customer service?

title: Taskforce Member- SRS Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: You have to send a cover letter and express why you are qualified and why you want to be part of SRS. Very easy to communicate if you have the qualifications
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be part of SRS?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a typical administrative interview. There seemed to be a little animosity between the academic nature of experience and the experience from the regular business world. The process itself started with a phone interview and then an in person with a panel.
Interview Questions: Do you think your business experience was deep enough to keep up with the education world.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Please take a look through Career Center posting jobs
Pick the position which make you feel comfortable
Applying online, but highly recommend submitting hard copy resume at the hiring department
Interview Questions: Simply asking your academic schedule

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Question asked during interview as well as a GPA requirement. Entered hiring managers office, then was asked typical questions that were not hard at all. pretty general and predicable. Most people that apply for the job will get the job. Science students however, are favored as biology and chemistry as subjects most athletes will take.
Interview Questions: Why do you believe you are qualified for this job

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple phone interview with  FDSM and RHC. Questions were basic interview questions with case scenarios. Quick and easy process. Lasted about 20 minutes. RHC and FDSM depend on which building you’re getting hired, so the questions and experience may vary.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation where: the phone is ringing, someone runs into the building, etc

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was informed by email that I was a finalist and asked to choose an interview date.  Interviewed with panel of 3 that worked in the department or related departments. Was asked general work related questions as well as well as very specific questions related to duties of the position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Program Coordinator/Administrative Support Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
its about 4-5 people that interview you. You are the head of the table and they each take turns reading the interview questions.

You are given a skills test at the computer, something like, draft a memo and some other basic skills, however I don't know if they still do this.

This is how they rate each response: Evaluate Response: Poor - Average - Good - Excellent 

At the end of the interview they do an overall tally/summary that looks like this:

Poor: This candidate is not well suited for this position

Below: Candidate could perform the essential fun ctions but would require training and supervision

Average: Can handle all critical aspects of the job and meet current standards

Good: Can easily handle all aspects of job. will make quick impact and require little to no training

Excellent: Will make quick impact in every area of the job; very well suited for the position

Then after this they make their recommendations with the hiring committee:

Determination:
Recommend for hire
Recommend for 2nd interview
Hold for further review
Do not recommend for hire
Interview Questions: Please tell us what you know about the college of extended studies and its role at SDSU?

title: Montezuma Publishing- Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Complete skills test (look for errors)
APA and MLA formatting (skills)
Examine small errors in writing
One on one with manager and supervisor, very relax interview to determine fit
*Did not  get an offer due to experience. Montezuma publishing was looking for a 2nd year junior, senior, or graduate student. I applied as a 1st year sophomore.  More experience you have in writing and research will help get job
Interview Questions:
Why are you a great fit?
Describe your personality?
Why do you want to work here?
What is your skill set and how does it apply to this job position?

title: Tennis Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online at SDSU careers, got a phone call and had a small phone interview 
Then had a 3-4 group panel interview and we toured the center
Very nice people, make you feel comfortable and they each have about 5-6 questions of their own they will ask you about your tennis background, experience and what you can add to their programs there at the arc
Interview Questions: How would you teach a tennis clinic filled with beginners?

title: Alternative Media Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very simple process. The supervisor talks to you and asks to introduce you. And then, if you were referred by another student already working there, it's likely that you will get hired on the spot, as was the case for me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Music Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: General Manager conducted the interview and asked questions about work ethic and goals. Asked about what you invision for the position and what you want to get out of the organization.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had the position

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: very nice interview, they were really thoughtful and they were nice interviewer. I was relaxed and wasn't afraid of anything. They were even more nice when I start working with them.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Onsite Interview around half an hour discussing about my strengths and weakness. What scope do I have to improve my skill matrix. 
What I can contribute towards the growth of the branch.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about database management?
Web development and web page testing
Servers, operating systems
Interactive maps.
programming skills and debugging skills

title: Police Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They scheduled me for a panel interview with a group of 4 staff members that individually asked me a question in regards to the job. After the interview was complete they said they would contact me for an invite to continue in the process and have an interview with the Chief of police. I was called for a following interview  and given a conditional job offer.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I have ever been in an situation where I have to tell my confront a co worker.

title: Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The application process was very intensive and did not require an interview. However, I would highly recommend meeting with the many professors within the department that you are applying to in order to get your name/face recognized with the board that will be doing the hiring. You are awarded the position simply based on your application and for those on the board that can speak on your behalf/testify to your skill set presented in the application.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Network Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very odd. I submitted my resume and was invited to interview the next week. It wasn't between me and one supervisor - it was between me and FOUR supervisors, a random guy from procurement, and all of their existing student workers. It just felt very odd. I was also given a list of questions they would ask me; basically just testing to see if you'll actually do some research before coming in. I did very well, and one of the supervisors wanted to hire me on the spot when I mentioned I spoofed my Mac address to get my Xbox One connected to the school network. After I was hired, I sat in on other student interviews and felt less confident about mine - they hired just about everybody who interviewed, regardless of how well they did or if they did any research.
Interview Questions:
What is the difference between an access point and a router?

Have you ever set up the wireless internet at your home?

What is an IP address? What is a MAC address?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email by the graduate coordinator at Exercise and Nutritional Sciences department that Dr. Kressler is interested in conducting an interview with me. Then we set the date and the time all via email
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: First you submit an application. The applications are distributed among the professors seeking a graduate assistant. If a professor approves your application, then that professor emails you or calls you to set up a telephone interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any classroom management experience? Can you handle a room of 100 students or more?

title: IT Consultant/Computer Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview Process is very simple. You sit down and answer questions you got asked easily. There is no coding questions you will be asked. You will be asked for simple personally knowledge and experience. Make sure you are comfortable with your resume and remember on what you had on there. You'll be asked to clarify.
Interview Questions: What language program do you know?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview regarding experiences and interest about the courses you have taken. also why you are applying or the Student Assistant ship position. How many hours will yo be available to work. check you F1 or student status
Interview Questions:
Have you worked before or had any experience before
what courses have you taken untill now?

title: PC/Network Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
- Applied online
- Dropped of a copy of my resume to the front desk
- Received a phone call
- Called in for a in person interview
- Signed pre-employment documents
- Coordinated with the College of Sciences and SDSU HR department with necessary documents.
Interview Questions: Basic trouble shooting and IT Knowledge

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was broken into three parts: desk exercise, interview with a committee, and an interview with the director. I came into the position with a lot of experience so I found the desk exercise to be relatively easy, however I took the full time allowed to make sure that I was satisfied with all of my documents.  I liked that I got to interview with a panel and with the director and had the opportunity to ask them questions as well.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you made a mistake and how you handled it

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an online app through SDSU career website. I was emailed by Director for an interview. Went to interview  and was given a general overview of the job and then was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Not really any difficult or unexpected questions, just asked if I was able to perform the duties as of me.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: panel with four interviewers asking you questions all at once. Not too difficult to prepare for, as the questions related directly to the job description. They are looking for professionalism, customer service, and enthusiasm.
Interview Questions: Why do you love SDSU

title: Network Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. As a student position, they just want to see how well you do your research and how you handle the questions. They first ask general questions, then it gets more technical. Towards the end they ask about how you would handle certain scenarios.They would rotate on asking the questions. The interview was a lot more relaxed than I thought.
Interview Questions: What is the OSI model?

title: Graduate Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: applied. met with the course coordinator. She described the job tasks, asked my former experience, then asked if I would like to accept the offer.
Interview Questions: no

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: I only had one interview. Overall the interview went really well.General interview questions were asked, overall experience, why you want to intern/work there, why you think you will be a great fit
Interview Questions: General questions were asked and nothing seemed too difficult

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview processed included a discussion with applicant on his interest and knowledge of the project prior to joining the project team, as well as discussion of prior laboratory experiences and past projects. Informal discussion followed by a sit-down interview. Hiring process included informing the applicant of project expectations, duration, and potential future projects.
Interview Questions: Please explain your experience in analytical chemistry, and what are your suspected findings from the analysis of this project.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: You have to look into odds. Have to constantly look around for jobs and try to communicate and show your need for job.
Interview Questions: As it is student assistant position nothing as far difficult or unexpected is asked.

title: Reasarch Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews one with the HR rep, second with the professor and last with the board reviewing the program. It took a total of 3 weeks from first to last interview, drug test, and background check. Most of the process was talking about what if there was a bigger role to play
Interview Questions: There are many more qualified applicants why should  you have a go?

title: Police Cadet Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is explained on the website, and if you are invited to the initial interview, they explain the interview process via email.  The initial interview is "rapid fire" questions.  It's a panel interview, consisting of three university employees.  Each panel member introduces themselves, including their job titles, and then the questions begin.  Each panelist asks three questions each, and they write your answers down.  Prepare for Behavioral Based Stress questions.  They're looking at how well you would respond under pressure, and how logical your thought process is under those conditions.  You will also be competing against lateral transfers (police officers with experience), which is unfair, in my opinion, to an entry level candidate like myself.  Lastly, be prepared to work a lot of overtime once you are hired.  The department is understaffed.
Interview Questions: You are working early morning, and find a student in her car crying, and she tells you she has been raped.  What would you do?

title: Evaluator/Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Simple application and interview
Interview Questions: if i could be any animal, what would it be?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Applying for the position was easy. When the paperwork was filed, I got a call from their IT Specialist asking the following:

1. Why I was interested in the position
2. How much experience I had in the IT field

A few days later I got a call back asking for an in-person interview. The in-person interview was a low-key panel interview with the IT Specialist, Systems Administrator, and the Technology Manager.

The Interview:
They asked me to showcase my skills and competence by performing various tasks such as:

1. Change folder permissions on Windows
2. Reset user passwords
3. Configure a static IP address with custom DNS
Interview Questions: If someone [your boss] asks you to do something while you're working on a task, how would you react?

title: Graduate Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application, there was no interview.
Interview Questions: There was no interview.

title: Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Diego State University
Interview Descriptions: Had to teach a class for twenty minutes as part of assessment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: 2 day interview process.  Set questions and format in-line with the California State University system.  Teaching presentation, research presentation, interviews with faculty committee, deans, and students.  Before on-campus interview, there was a phone interview with the committee, check of references, submitting of several essays which summarized research goals, professional experience, and teaching pedagogy.
Interview Questions: what is your opinion of our curriculum

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked by my department chair if I would be interested in the position. After expressing interest, I had to submit my resume & apply through the university with his recommendation. There was no formal interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: MSR I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is a group interview and is very straight forward. It is really simple to adjust to all of the questions that will be asked and they are very simple straight forward questions. Sometimes you may have to adjust to others who are applying as well as an answer may be the same. You'd rather stand out than not.  It is a two step process and the second interview is you individually.
Interview Questions: What is previous Customer service experience.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Laid back. Interviewer asked about skills and interests (experiences with technology). The Interview process was pretty easy and laid back. The workers were very enthusiastic about working there. I applied in person and got a call back a couple of days later. Went in for an interview and then got a call back for an offer a few days later. Started the job after all the documents were submitted and processed by Human Resources.
Interview Questions: Describe your skills, etc.

title: Lavin Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Came in.  Lots of people waiting. Well dressed people all I suits and ties.  Everyone seemed very keen on getting the position.  The interviews were very nice but I was just bad.  So no offer.
Interview Questions: What are some of your weaknesses?

title: IRB Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed once for this position.  It was a structured interview with two members of the IRB.  Some of the questions felt redundant, but I imagine that maintaining consistency in your answers without worrying about variety will take you far.  They provided a paper-based "quiz" at the end of the interview with sample IRB cases and responses.
Interview Questions: The quiz at the end was unexpected.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at San Diego State University (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: First time I went in I had to take a computer test and write a sample letter inviting a guest to SDSU. I was called back for an interview with three directors and a staff member. The interview was two hours long and a bit awkward because the interviewers had to follow a very set script in order to ensure fairness and could not ask follow up questions or engage in conversation. After my answers, all four interviewers would take time to write notes in silence since no one could fill the dead space. Very strange dynamic that doesn't create a very warm environment.
Interview Questions: All questions were scripted and given to all candidates exactly the same way. No follow up, no casual conversation. They listed the entire job description and asked if there was anything I was not able to handle.
